definition: Nara, an old capital of Japan
how can one help
good/very/very much
Nara prefecture in central Japan
Nara period (710-794) in early Japanese history

sentences.english: Black Email is spacing out in the corner, contemplating an alternative life in Nara City.
sentences.chinese: 黑郵件在角落裏發呆，想着奈良城的別有洞天。

sentences.english: Rescue workers search for missing people among the debris in Gojo, Nara Prefecture.
sentences.chinese: 在奈良縣五條，救援人員在殘骸中尋找失蹤人員。

sentences.english: On his day-off Nara looks for trouble in Glass City.
sentences.chinese: 每逢假期，奈良就在格拉斯司迪裏找麻煩。

sentences.english: Canberra-Nara park with Kasuga stone lanterns framed by the gate.
sentences.chinese: 堪培拉奈良公園的大門上裝飾着日本春日的石燈籠。

sentences.english: I do not want to go to Tokyo, Osaka, Kobe and Nara.
sentences.chinese: 我不再想去東京，大阪，神戶，奈良。

sentences.english: Todaiji, first built in Nara period, was destroyed in war at the end of the Peace Time.
sentences.chinese: 東大寺初建於奈良時代，平安末期毀於戰火。

sentences.english: The world’s biggest wooden building is the grand temple of Todai-ji in the city of Nara.
sentences.chinese: 世界上最大的木製建築是奈良市宏偉的東大寺寺廟。

sentences.english: Nara houses one of the largest bronze Buddha statues in the world.
sentences.chinese: 奈良收藏了世界最大的青銅佛像之一。

Kiyomizu temple in east Kyōto 京都, Japan
